DOC.brief_summary: This is a multi-center, prospective, non-interventional cohort study . Its primary objectives are: 1. assess DILI patients' clinical characteristics, disease progression and influencing factors in clinical practice; 2. learn about suspected drug caused DILI,rechallenging, liver biochemical abnormalities mode, etc.
DOC.brief_title: A Prospective Cohort Study on Drug-induced Liver Injury in China（DILI-P）
DOC.detailed_description: The main purpose of this study is to understand patients with DILI clinical outcome and influencing factors in China's second and tertiary general hospitals (including Western medicine hospital, Chinese medicine hospital andIntegrated traditional Chinese and Western Medicine Hospital) and vulnerabilities of drug-induced liver injury specialist hospital (tuberculosis hospital, Pulmonary, etc.) in mainland. The main purpose 1. assess the DILI patients' clinical outcomes and influencing factors in the real world; 2. learn about suspected drug caused DILI,rechallenging, liver biochemical abnormalities mode, etc. Secondary objectives 1. assess the compliance of the DILI practice to the 2015 vision of the DILI guidelines in china.; 2. evaluate the histological features of DILI patients; 3. assessment DILI characteristics, prognosis and influencing factors in specific populations(such as the elderly, children with underlying liver disease background, etc.)
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of DILI patients with various types and severity according to the 2015 version of the Chinese DILI treatment guidelines RUCAM ≥6, or RUCAM between 35 is required by the three experts determined that the druginduced liver injury patient can provide informed consent form nondruginduced liver injury
